definition: to conduct/to command/to direct/conductor (of an orchestra)/CL:個|个[ge4]
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
lit. to direct blindly/to issue confused orders/to give contradictory directions

pinyin: kang4 zhen4 jiu4 zai1 zhi3 hui1 bu4

definition: Command right and you will be obeyed cheerfully. (idiom)
pinyin: zhi3 hui1 you3 fang1 , ren2 ren2 le4 cong2

sentences.english: The bayonet squad made a surprise attack and wiped out the enemy's command post.
sentences.chinese: 尖刀班出奇制胜，捣毁了敌人指挥部。

sentences.english: The communication between the panzer and commanding car is realized by the wireless data transmission module.
sentences.chinese: 装甲车辆与指挥车之间的通信通过无线数传模块实现。

sentences.english: USAF fixed and deployable ground command and control systems.
sentences.chinese: 美国空军固定和移动陆地指挥控制系统。

sentences.english: The command post was set up in a forward position.
sentences.chinese: 指挥部设在前沿阵地上。

sentences.english: Captain Aoyagi, the company commander, was killed while he directed the defense.
sentences.chinese: 连队指挥官，青柳上尉，在直接参加防御战时阵亡。

sentences.english: Adopt matter element theory to analyze validity of Yiwa battle command.
sentences.chinese: 利用物元分析方法分析宜瓦战役的指挥决策过程。

sentences.english: I left a sergeant in command and rode forward to reconnoitre.
sentences.chinese: 我留下一名中士指挥，自己策马前去侦察敌情。

sentences.english: Assistant directors often have to direct the extras in the background.
sentences.chinese: 助理导演总是得指挥背景里的群众演员。

sentences.english: Yoda, acting as general, oversaw the battle from the forward command center.
sentences.chinese: 尤达担任统帅，在前线指挥中心督战。

sentences.english: After succeeding in landing on George Island, the captain sent a radio message to his headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 胜利登上乔治岛后，船长向指挥部发了一份无线电报。

sentences.english: The appearance of C3I system is great evolvement of command roboticized.
sentences.chinese: C3I系统的出现是指挥自动化的重大进展。

sentences.english: He was part of the battalion's planning team, but he hoped to finish the tour as a front-line company commander.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名营级指挥官，但他想要去前线亲自指挥作战。

sentences.english: He was part of the battalion's planning team, but he hoped to finish the tour as a front-line company commander.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名营级指挥官，但他想要去前线亲自指挥作战。

sentences.english: Following Afghan tradition, local commanders are building independent fiefs that they will be reluctant to relinquish.
sentences.chinese: 按照阿富汗的传统，当地的指挥官都愿意自立王国。

sentences.english: During the tenth five year plan, an earthquake emergency command system will be constructed in China.
sentences.chinese: 十五”期间，将建设中国地震应急指挥技术系统。

sentences.english: A worker is screened for radiation before entering the emergency operation center at the nuclear plant.
sentences.chinese: 进入应急指挥中心前，工作人员接受核辐射检查。

definition: to dispatch (vehicles, staff etc)/to schedule/to manage/dispatcher/scheduler
to go to war/to engage in war
under one's control or administration/subordinates/(money etc) on hand/sb's financial means/to take action
to transfer/to maneuver (troops etc)/movement of personnel/to mobilize/to bring into play
